intro: Sinosenecio brevior, commonly known as the short-stemmed sinosenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture and a bluish-green hue. Sinosenecio brevior produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months, contributing to its ecological role in pollinator habitats.
